posts.author: wst4
posts.title: And they're going to vote for this, good luck!

posts.raw_content:
Ryan Girdusky — the sharp-tongued conservative strategist and 1776 Project PAC founder you heard on The Greg Kelly Show today — just dropped a political nuke on the 2025 NYC mayoral race. His core argument: This isn’t a normal election. It’s a turnout tsunami. And that wave is about to drown Zohran Mamdani’s socialist revolution while carrying Andrew Cuomo — baggage and all — back into City Hall.You heard the numbers right: Typical NYC mayoral races draw 1.1–1.3 million voters. Girdusky says this one will hit 2.4 million — nearly double the norm. And he’s not guessing. He’s reading the early voting tea leaves, demographic shifts, and a citywide “wake-up call” against Mamdani’s far-left agenda. Let’s break it down — step by step — with hard data, polling trends, and why the “likely voter” models are now worthless.The Turnout Explosion Is Already Happening — And It’s Not Mamdani’s Base

Early voting began October 25. In just three days, 223,000 New Yorkers voted — five times the first weekend of 2021. By Day 4? 298,000+. Experts now project over 500,000 early votes alone — and that’s before Election Day (Nov 4).This isn’t random. It’s older, moderate, and anti-Mamdani voters flooding the polls:55+: >50% of early voters; Mamdani loses this group by double digits (Cuomo +4 to +15)
Under 35: Only 16% of early voters; Mamdani’s core — but not showing up
Registered Dems: 74% — but not progressives; mostly pre-2016 enrollees

Mamdani’s own super PAC is panicking in fundraising emails: “Older New Yorkers are dominating early voting — we need your help NOW.”Translation: The youth surge that won him the June primary? It’s gone. The DSA/WFP machine mobilized 1 million in a low-turnout Dem primary. But in a general election with 2.4 million voters, that’s just 25% of the electorate — not enough.Mamdani’s Voter Ceiling: ~600,000 Hardcore Progressives

Girdusky’s math is brutal but airtight:Mamdani won the June Democratic primary with ~580,000 votes under Ranked Choice Voting (56% final round).
That was with record progressive turnout — AOC, Bowman, DSA door-knockers, TikTok mobs.
His absolute ceiling in a general? ~600,000 loyalists — mostly under-40, college-educated, Brooklyn/Queens renters.

Now do the division: 600,000 ÷ 2,400,000 total voters = 25%Even if he hits 40% overall, that’s 960,000 votes — but only if everyone else stays home. They’re not. They’re running to the polls to stop him.Why Likely Voter Models Are “Out the Window”

Pollsters like Quinnipiac and Suffolk build models on past election behavior. They ask: “Did you vote in 2021? 2017? Primaries?”But 2025 is not 2021. That was a sleepy, post-COVID, one-party race. This is a referendum on socialism in New York.When turnout doubles, new voters flood in — and they don’t fit the model. These are:Suburban moderates (Staten Island, South Brooklyn, Eastern Queens)
Older Jewish voters (furious over Mamdani’s Gaza rhetoric and gifted program attacks)
Asian parents (livid over his plan to eliminate gifted & talented programs)
Hispanic working-class Dems (breaking for Cuomo 2-to-1 in Suffolk tracking)

These groups skipped 2021. They’re voting now. And polls don’t see them coming.The Polls Are Tightening — Fast

Here’s the latest likely voter polling (all October 2025):Quinnipiac (Oct 22–26): Mamdani 43%, Cuomo 33%, Sliwa 14%, Undecided 6%
Suffolk (Oct 23–26): Mamdani 44%, Cuomo 34%, Sliwa 11%, Undecided 7%
Manhattan Inst. (Oct 22–26): Mamdani 43%, Cuomo 28%, Sliwa 19%, Undecided 8%
AARP/Gotham (Oct 15–20): Mamdani 43%, Cuomo 29%, Sliwa 19%, Undecided 5%

Key trends:Mamdani’s lead shrunk from 20+ points in September to single digits
Cuomo gained 10–15 points with Hispanics and independents
Head-to-head: Mamdani 44% – Cuomo 40% (Manhattan Inst.) — statistical tie

And Polymarket flipped yesterday: Mamdani’s win probability dropped below 60%, with Cuomo surging.The “Wake-Up Call” Against Mamdani Is Real — And It’s Working

New Yorkers aren’t stupid. They’ve seen:Rent freeze extremism → would collapse new housing construction
“Phase out” gifted programs → direct attack on Asian and merit-based families
NYPD reform 2.0 → after crime spiked post-2020
“Tax the rich” to fund utopia → while businesses flee

Girdusky calls Mamdani a “radical operative” — and the nickname “Zohran the Moron” is sticking in outer-borough diners.Even Democrats are defecting. One viral X thread from a lifelong Dem in Bayside: “I voted for AOC. I’m voting Cuomo now. Mamdani wants to turn NYC into Berkeley. Hard pass.”Cuomo Wins — Ugly, But He Wins

Let’s run Girdusky’s 2.4 million voter scenario:Andrew Cuomo (I): ~1,050,000 votes (43–45%)
Zohran Mamdani (D): ~960,000 votes (40%)
Curtis Sliwa (R): ~350,000 votes (15%)

How?Cuomo sweeps 55+, picks up 40% of Hispanics, 30% of independents
Sliwa holds GOP base but refuses to drop out (hurting consolidation)
Mamdani maxes at 600k loyalists + 360k soft Dems → falls short

Even if Sliwa takes 15%, Cuomo wins with a plurality — just like Adams in 2021.Final Verdict: Girdusky Called ItThis election isn’t about who’s likable. It’s about who shows up.And right now, New York is showing up to stop Zohran Mamdani.Cuomo’s a flawed messenger — COVID scandals, #MeToo, ego the size of the Hudson. But he’s the firewall. And with 2.4 million voters, the firewall holds.Prediction: Cuomo wins 48–46 in a squeaker. Mamdani’s revolution dies in the ballot box — drowned by a blue-collar, senior-citizen, moderate-Dem tsunami.As Girdusky tweeted this morning: “Socialism loses when people vote. And New York is about to vote like never before.”Sources:  NYC BOE Early Vote Report, Oct 27  
NYC BOE, Oct 28  
Suffolk University Crosstabs, Oct 26  
Mamdani Super PAC Email, Oct 28  
NYC BOE Certified Primary Results, June 2025  
Suffolk Tracking Poll, Oct 23–26  
Polymarket “NYC Mayor 2025” Contract
posts.author: YodaBannon
